world_lore: The mall speakers play the same six songs on endless repeat, a soundtrack to desperation and determination.
Parking lots stretch into infinity, each row more crowded than the last, every spot a mirage.
Returns lines snake through stores like patient serpents, receipts clutched in sweaty hands.
Online shopping promised convenience, but the delivery windows lie and packages vanish into the void.
The perfect gift exists somewhere in this chaos - you just have to find it before someone else does.
